ddf.catalog.source.solr

Class UnavailableSolrCatalogProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • ddf.catalog.source.solr.UnavailableSolrCatalogProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CatalogProvider, Source, Maskable, Describable

    public class UnavailableSolrCatalogProvider
extends Object
implements CatalogProvider
    This class is used to signify an unavailable CatalogProvider instance. If a user tries to unsuccessfully connect to Solr, then a message will be displayed to check the connection.

    • Method Detail

      • getContentTypes

        public Set<ContentType> getContentTypes()
        Description copied from interface: Source
        Gets the ContentTypes that are currently stored by the Source. Notice the return object is a Set, meaning it returns all unique content types found in the Source without duplications.
        Specified by:
        getContentTypes in interface Source
        Returns:
        a Set of ContentTypes currently available from this Source.

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable()
        Description copied from interface: Source
        This method states whether this source is available, typically connecting and performing some sort of simple query or ping to the native catalog.

        This is expected to be an expensive operation, possibly involving network I/O. Typically only CatalogFramework implementations will call this and only periodically.

        Specified by:
        isAvailable in interface Source
        Returns:
        true - if the site is available (up), false - if the site is unavailable (down)
        See Also:
        ddf.catalog.util.SourcePoller

      • isAvailable

        public boolean isAvailable(SourceMonitor callback)
        Description copied from interface: Source
        This method is the same as Source.isAvailable() but allows a caller to provide a SourceMonitor callback object which is meant to be used as a way for the Source to dynamically contact the caller with its availability. The intent is to return a boolean as to whether the Source is available at this very moment and also to use the SourceMonitor object to update the caller of this method if this Source's availability changes later in the future.
        Specified by:
        isAvailable in interface Source
        Parameters:
        callback - - used to notify the caller of this method when the Source object wants to update its availability.
        Returns:
        true - if the site is available (up), false - if the site is unavailable (down)

        Description copied from interface: Describable

        Example: html for a MetacardTransformer that transforms Metacards to HTML

      • maskId

        public void maskId(String sourceId)
        Description copied from interface: Maskable
        Instructs this source of the id to use when reporting an id externally. When instructed, the provided ID must be used and can not be overridden.
        Specified by:
        maskId in interface Maskable
        Parameters:
        sourceId - the new id to use

      • create

        public CreateResponse create(CreateRequest createRequest)
                      throws IngestException
        Description copied from interface: CatalogProvider
        Publishes a list of Metacard objects into the catalog.
        Specified by:
        create in interface CatalogProvider
        Parameters:
        createRequest - - the CreateRequest that includes a List of Metacard objects to be stored in a Source. The ID of the Metacard object will be ignored and populated / generated by the CatalogProvider when the record has been stored.
        Returns:
        the CreateResponse containing a List of fully populated metacards. This should be similar to the parameter list of Metacard objects but it must have the ddf.catalog.data.Metacard ID populated.
        Throws:
        IngestException - if any problem occurs when storing the metacards

      • delete

        public DeleteResponse delete(DeleteRequest deleteRequest)
                      throws IngestException
        Description copied from interface: CatalogProvider
        Deletes records specified by a list of attribute values such as an id attribute.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface CatalogProvider
        Parameters:
        deleteRequest - - the DeleteRequest containing the attribute values associated with Metacards to delete
        Returns:
        a DeleteResponse with Metacards that were deleted. These Metacards are fully populated in preparation for any processing services.
        Throws:
        IngestException - if an issue occurs during the delete

      • update

        public UpdateResponse update(UpdateRequest updateRequest)
                      throws IngestException
        Description copied from interface: CatalogProvider
        Updates a list of Metacard records. Metacard records that are not in the Catalog will not be created.
        Specified by:
        update in interface CatalogProvider
        Parameters:
        updateRequest - - the UpdateRequest that includes updates to Metacard records that have been previously stored in a Source. A given Attribute name-value pair in this request must uniquely identify zero metacards or one metacard in the Source, otherwise an IngestException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        the UpdateResponse containing a List of Update objects that represent the new (updated) and old (previous) Metacard records.
        Throws:
        IngestException - if an issue occurs during the update such as multiple records were matched for a single update entry
